  1. Cli
  2. Curl

Overview

  • command line url reference

Synopsis 

curl <url|ip>:[port]

Options

Request

  • -f â€“fail: fail silently on server error

  • -A | â€“user-agent eg: "Mozilla/4.0"

  • -c â€“cookie-jar
    • where to keep the cookie jar
  • -H â€“header <header>
    • set custom headers. This option can be invoked multiple times

  • -L | â€“location Follow relocation headers

  • -: | â€“location Follow 300 redirects

  • -X â€“request
    • what type of request to send

  • â€“referer: where did request come from eg: â€“referer http://curl.haxx.se http://daniel.haxx.se

  • â€“no-sesionid No cache - G|â€“get

  • â€“keepalive-time
    • how long connection is idle before sending keepalive probe
    • @default: 60s
  • -d | â€“data Data to attach to the request
    • send details with application/x-www-form-urlencoded. header

  • -data-urlencode Encodes data before sending it

  • -F | â€“form <name=content> Post request
    • multipart/form-data eg. -F â€œname=daniel;type=text/fooâ€

Security

  • -k | â€“insecure Allows insecure SSL connection

  • â€“crlfile: provide PEM file eg: â€“crlfile mycert.pem https://that.secure.server.com

  • -u â€“user
    • user/password for auth
    • default: auth is basic-auth

Output

  • -# | â€“progress-bar Show progress

  • -I | â€“head only fetch headers

  • -i â€“include
    • include http header in output

  • -o | â€“output Write to output

  • -s | â€“silent No progress

  • -w | â€“write-out : what to write after successful request time_<...>: time in seconds

  • -S: show error message if fail

  • â€“trace-ascii: store log of requests

Cook 

# get
curl http://miigroups.com/forms?name="kevin"&press="OK"
curl http://www.weridserver.com:8000/-> get website using port 8000

# post
# will use content type: application/x-www.form-urlencoded
curl --data "name=kevin" http://www.miigroups.com/form
curl --data-urlencode "name=kevin" http://www.miigroups.com/form
curl --data "param1=value1&param2=value2" https://example.com/resource.cgi
